Royal Mail understands that not all customers are comfortable with technology-based solutions and prefers to get their mail in traditional ways. While implementing technological advancements to improve the delivery process, Royal mail also needs to ensure that the needs and preferences of traditional customers are met.

Royal Mail can consider the following options to address the concerns of traditional customers:

1. Provide alternative delivery options - Royal Mail can provide alternative means of delivery for traditional customers, such as offering physical delivery confirmations or postal updates through phone, post or other channels.

2. Improve Customer service- Royal Mail can provide exceptional customer support for traditional customers by ensuring that they can get real-time updates and personalized assistance on any queries or concerns.

3. Educate customers - Royal Mail can educate traditional customers on the new technology-based systems via guides, tutorials, and other forms of assistance, ensuring they are comfortable and knowledgeable.

4. Opt-Out options - Royal mail can provide the option for customers to opt-out of any new technology solutions, ensuring transparency and allowing traditional customers to choose their preferred means of mail delivery.

In summary, while implementing technological solutions to improve the delivery process, Royal Mail must also prioritize the needs and preferences of traditional customers by providing alternative service options, improving customer support, and offering appropriate education and opt-out choices.
